Waterville Valley attracts many visitors in the winter months with alpine skiing at Waterville Valley Resort and many miles of trails for cross-country skiing .
During the summer , attractions include a golf course , tennis courts , and lots of hiking .
The Mad River flows through the town , providing great views all year round .
Waterville valley was first settled in the 1760s , and incorporated as Waterville in 1829 .
The name Waterville Valley was adopted in 1967 .
Take Exit 28 on I-93 then follow route 49 east for about 11 miles .
Resort is a pedestrian-friendly village , so once you 're here you can leave your car parked and easily get around on foot or bike .
